item.title: Using logistic regression to classify images
item.description: In this blog post I show how to use logistic regression to classify images. Logistic regression is a statistical method for binary classification, i.e. for analyzing the dependency of a binary outcome on one or more independent variables. In a previous blog post I described linear regression. If you’re not familiar with linear regression read that post first. Let’s briefly recap: Linear Regression Linear regression is a statistical method for predicting the value of a continuous dependent variable based on one or several explanatory variables.

item.title: Understanding linear regression
item.description: Regression represents one of the cornerstones of machine learning. Comprehending its logic and math provides a solid foundation for learning more advanced machine learning techniques such as neural networks. Linear regression is a statistical method for modeling the relationship between variables. It’s used for analyzing dependencies and predicting values. The underlying idea of linear regression is simple: given a dataset, we want to find the dependency of one of the variables in the dataset on one, some or all of the other variables.
